summary: Ernestine G. Johnson was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She is mentioned in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to January 1979. These documents list her name, social security number, position, salary, and employment dates within the SCAS. The documents suggest she was a staff member involved in the committee's operations during its investigation.
significance: Ernestine G. Johnson's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation into the JFK assassination, albeit in a staff or administrative capacity.
